title: What's the tradeoff manaless champions pay for not having a manabar?
body: Because as i see it,manaless champions have no drawback whatsoever compared to,everyone else who has a blue bar to abide to.Skills from manaless champions have the same ratios and usually the same cooldowns as those from champions who get restricted by a manabar.So what's the point of playing a blue bar slave,really?

replies.body:
Honestly, Mana probably just isn't in a great state at the moment. At a recent meeting, we were talking about some mage champions and how we felt about their Mana usage, and one of the things we got to talking about was that it would be nice to feel like there were greater benefits to being a Mana champion, because Mana serves almost exclusively as a tool to restrict champions in the early game.

It would be really cool if there was a world where people could feel good about their champion being a Mana user, because it provided them with really cool itemization and playstyle options, or maybe it had really powerful late game implications. Unfortunately, it's just mostly used as a tool to hold harrass and sustain patterns back in the early game, and there are probably opportunities for us to utilize it better.

Is that not the main purpose of mana, though? To be a type of resource that restricts you in the long run, but not so much in short trades? Aka, a resource that limits your sustain in lane and long sieges, but not in teamfights and short skirmishes? And you can play around these limitations by careful mana management (playstyle) or lowering the restriction through dedicated itemization.

Meanwhile, energy is a different resource that limits you in short trades, but not in the long run due to its fast regeneration. Meaning, not a limit in lane, but a great limit in teamfights - the antithesis to mana. Additionally, the pattern generated by energy makes CdR a less desirable stat.

Before the changes to Banshee's all the way back, it used to be more suited to mana users than to manaless champs. Additionally, manaless APs will never get as much AP or CdR as mana-using ones - both high AP and high CdR are mostly tied to items giving either mana or mana regen. Same goes for tanks, for whom the high CdR values are coupled to high mana values.

----

P.S.: How are you feeling about 5.23 Quinn? Is she performing to your expectation? What would you do if she was found too strong in the jungle, but ok in lane?

Historically, that is the purpose of Mana, yes, and that's about all we've ever done with it as well. It would be nice if was not only functional, but actually felt cool to have. It would be sweet to buy a Catalyst because it gave you a really cool synergy with your Mana bar, for example, rather than because it somewhat helped you to overcome your Mana bar.

As to Quinn, she's too strong. I've made a few comments elsewhere by now, but we'll tune her back a bit in the next patch. Her Q is doing too much at the moment.
maybe give mages small "**current** mana ratio" on their spells? can lead to some interesting scenarios imo...

What about Energy champions? They never need to get Energy Regen from items.

Edit: Thank you to all the players that are willing to explain the strengths and weaknesses to Energy champions to me! This will help me better understand their strengths and weaknesses. I only own two of the energy users {{champion:238}} & {{champion:64}}. But this will help so much!

Though they can't expand on their energypool either.
Mana champs can buy mana items to get to the point where they don't have to worry about mana anymore,energy champs can't do that.
Alright. That makes sense! I guess proper management of their resource is REALLY how to tell a new player from a great player. Would make sense. Thank you for explaining!
my poor {{champion:84}}  doesnt have an energy regen in her skills =/, people dont like giving blue buff to me
Doesn't she get some return from her Q mark?

> [{quoted}](name=TemporalDonut,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T17:19:56.276+0000)
>
> Doesn't she get some return from her Q mark?

It's not enough to compensate for e spam.

> [{quoted}](name=DracoMTA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-27T01:13:05.897+0000)
>
> It's not enough to compensate for e spam.

It's not supposed to be enough. When they reduced her E's cooldown by 2 seconds at all ranks they said they did it to give her an energy dump - i.e. to give a champion who's pretty hard to fail with mechanically a bit more skill via energy management.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T10:48:11.215+0000)
>
> Though they can't expand on their energypool either.
> Mana champs can buy mana items to get to the point where they don't have to worry about mana anymore,energy champs can't do that.

Karthus Anivia Kassadin Cassiopeia ALL have the worst mana issues. Even late game
But most champs don't have these problems and even these champs can still lower their mana problems by buying some mana items.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2015-11-26T22:28:28.014+0000)
>
> But most champs don't have these problems and even these champs can still lower their mana problems by buying some mana items.

I said even late game when they are full build. But you see mages got nerfed this pre season. That mana regen bullshit isnt enough for Karthus or Anivia. And they do have mana problems cause they are mana hungry as hell.

And I said that it still lessens the problem to some extent.
I mean I play Swain a lot and he is also quite mana hungry,but with the right items you still get to cast more spells late game.
Karthus and Anivia are similar in that mana is still a valuable resource for them,but they still get to do more thanks to items.

And these champs at least have the option to just buy more mana(like rod of ages+seraph embrace actually synergizes quite well),energy champs don't have that option in the first place.
Energy champions tend to have the weakness that they can't constantly output abilities, with the strength that they can stay around for longer overall.

Please show me a resourceless champion with Xerath level poke.  Or even an energy champion -- Zed and Kennen are notorious for the amount of poke they *do* have without a manabar, but that's nowhere near the level of even a mediocre mage.

Almost all of the truly resourceless champions are melee, and often squishy.  Gnar is one or the other.

Now if you're going to say "then what's the point of playing a squishy melee with a manabar", {{champion:121}} {{champion:91}} think you have a point because they really are a bit weak right now, but most of them have unique things they can do and/or their mana problems aren't as bad as a mage anyway.
http://i.imgur.com/YAGpXPd.png

> [{quoted}](name=Partholonian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-11-26T13:28:03.578+0000)
>
> Please show me a resourceless champion with Xerath level poke.  Or even an energy champion -- Zed and Kennen are notorious for the amount of poke they *do* have without a manabar, but that's nowhere near the level of even a mediocre mage.
> 
> Almost all of the truly resourceless champions are melee, and often squishy.  Gnar is one or the other.
> 
> Now if you're going to say "then what's the point of playing a squishy melee with a manabar", {{champion:121}} {{champion:91}} think you have a point because they really are a bit weak right now, but most of them have unique things they can do and/or their mana problems aren't as bad as a mage anyway.

{{champion:101}} 's _THE_ poke/siege mage though, not saying your wrong necessarily, just that that's an awful comparison.

You make a fair point. However I must ask you what's the drawback on {{champion:86}} ? I'm not trying to be salty but it seems like unless you completely obliterate his early game he will just snowball into Garland.

You have a good point, but the resource-less champions that I often see most {{champion:92}} and {{champion:157}} can both just completely ignore poke with fairly low cool down defenses. However, you're correct, they got no poke, except Yasuo's 3rd Q.

Windwall has a 26 second cooldown at rank 1 (which it will be for most of the game), decreasing to 18 seconds -- still not exactly short -- at max rank.  And Yasuo will probably not build much, if any, CDR because his other skills don't benefit at all.

Riven's shield actually is short cooldown, but she has really terrible health regen and no kit sustain, so if she ever takes an unshielded hit, that damage is there until she backs or uses a potion, pretty much.

They also can't do anything in a teamfight without risking being blown up quite quickly, unless they are very fed, same as {{champion:55}}.

Its due to the fact that any mana user once they get past 10 minutes, mana become worthless, I have played Lux plenty of times which is one of the most mana hungrey champs in the game and once like 10 minutes go by and she has her Unholy, mana might as well not exist anymore.

But I would say mostly for diversity. It would get pretty boring not to mention wouldn't make sense on a lot of champs if everyone just had a mana bar instead of nothing/energy/mana/hp. Why would Garen have to spend mana to do an overhead swing at you? Why would Lee sin use mana when all his power is from his body? He is using his own energy to do what he does and gets tired if he doesn't pace himself.

Sure you can make the arguement of Riven/Garen/Katarina(3 biggest no resource champs) can use energy, but it really wouldn't make much sense for the most part. Its just an overhead swing, or throwing a dagger, that isn't that exerting vs pushing your body to the limit and flying jump kicking you(Albiet unrealistically but still)

Basically its for more mundane attacks vs the energy ones which are usually a bit more flashy.

> [{quoted}](name=Shonjl,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-11-26T11:04:19.341+0000)

> But I would say mostly for diversity. It would get pretty boring not to mention wouldn't make sense on a lot of champs if everyone just had a mana bar instead of nothing/energy/mana/hp. Why would Garen have to spend mana to do an overhead swing at you? Why would Lee sin use mana when all his power is from his body? He is using his own energy to do what he does and gets tired if he doesn't pace himself.

Darius, Alistar, Braum, Fiora, Gangplank, Hecarim, Jax, Olaf, Poppy, Rammus, Udyr, etc.
I don't get what you are implying here
None of them are any more magical than Garen or Lee Sin, so why would they have mana while Garen and Lee Sin do not?

Darius has his bleed, Alistar has a heal, Braum has Winter's Bite (magically shooting ice at people), Fiora I'll give you, Gangplank's ult might as well be magic, Hecarim's Onslaught of Shadows,Poppy is Poppy and is changing anyway, Rammus has his ult, Udyr is summoning fire..

If we look at, say, Garen...all his abilities are just different ways that he swings his sword.  Nothing magical.  All of those champions have something magical about the, hence the mana.
I'm pretty sure summoning a giant sword from the sky to impale your enemies is magical.
Haven't you heard about the law of magical swords falling from the sky of physics? I have a test on it tomorrow!
GP's ult is just him calling his ship to shoot an area.... wtf is magical about that in any way...
He uses magic to summon rum for his crew. That's how he gets them to obey.

It's magical now because his ship got blown up

and his oranges are likely magical as well, youre telling me that oranges can do more than celestial power? ({{champion:16}} )

Bananas can't renove cc

Oranges can
Using magical energy to slap people with sticks is fun.

Its just an overhead swing, or throwing a dagger, that isn't that exerting vs pushing your body to the limit and flying jump kicking you(Albiet unrealistically but still)

you sacrifice a ton of damage to buy an {{item:3174}} . that has always been the payoff to that item. resourcless champs sacrifice nothing and energy base champs can still benefit off blue buff without sacrificing damage.

the point being is that mana champs have to spend xxxx amount of gold AND a item slot to "solve mana problems" WITH a downside where as resourceless champs spend nothing and sacrifice nothing with zero downside.

they can go pure class canon and spam the hell out of there abilities if they want to. try going full class canon on lux with zero mana  or mana regen items and spam your abilities, see how fast you go oom and see how fast you become useless.

It used to be they had high cooldowns and no hard CC {{champion:86}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:102}} (cept her ult) {{champion:36}} 

But then Riot Kept going {{champion:58}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:157}}{{champion:92}} {{champion:154}}

{{champion:68}} /{{champion:150}} have to manage heat/rage. That's a drawback.
{{champion:36}} {{champion:154}}  have hp cost on their skills. That's a resource.

> [{quoted}](name=orneff,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2015-11-26T14:13:53.720+0000)
>
> {{champion:68}} /{{champion:150}} have to manage heat/rage. That's a drawback.
> {{champion:36}} {{champion:154}}  have hp cost on their skills. That's a resource.

did you saw a mundo or zac going out of hp once? going under 90% of their hp after spamming their Q/W?

Its still a cost they have to bear.
Of course they won't kill themselves from that,but it is still something they need to keep an eye out.
Thats why mundo can't just perma-use his W,why he has to be careful to land his cleaver,why zac needs to take risks to get his blobs,etc.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T15:02:08.532+0000)
>
> Its still a cost they have to bear.
> Of course they won't kill themselves from that,but it is still something they need to keep an eye out.
> Thats why mundo can't just perma-use his W,why he has to be careful to land his cleaver,why zac needs to take risks to get his blobs,etc.

no, since it won't make them under 90% hp, they don't need to keep an eye on their ressource, ESPECIALLY zac

They need their hp to stay alive in a fight.
If they fell under 90%,then that would hurt them really badly,even more than a mage who is low on mana.

And overall they can't be careless or they would fall under 90%,even mundo will start to loose health if he keeps his W on for too long and misses his Q a lot.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Z2aEJTLM,comment-id=000900000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T16:21:10.316+0000)

> If they fell under 90%,then that would hurt them really badly,even more than a mage who is low on mana.
> 
> And overall they can't be careless or they would fall under 90%,even mundo will start to loose health if he keeps his W on for too long and misses his Q a lot.

the problem is that they NEVER FELL under 90%,

if mundo keeps his W on for a too long time that means that this mundo is dumb

but his Q doesn't get him out of hp, his passive+base hp regen compensate the hp lost on his Q

If you want to be so stubborn with 90%, every Zac's spell cost 4% of current health. That means with QWE rotation he deals himself 12% pure damage of current health.
Aatrox deals himself 10% of current health pure damage on Q and 5% on E. That's 15% pure damage of current health.
Tell me again how they pay nothing for being manaless.
Mundo's health costs are lower, but are very present in lane. Try poking someone on cooldown and you'll see how quickly it all adds up.
Actually I believe it does pure damage, meaning it ignores shields they get as well.

ya, there really is no pay off.  riot always said "we feel mana champs should be weak when OOM, so this is why we are blah blah blah eve W nerf blah blah blah lux E 130 mana" meanwhile {{champion:157}} *E E E E E E E E E E E E E E E E EE E E E E E E Q Q R in 1.5 seconds* {{champion:99}} *goes OOM just trying to proc his shield* {{champion:157}}  "lol, good thing you went OOM, you almost took 1% of my HP"


so stupid to watch this guy dash around minions endlessly with no punishment as a mana hungry champ
